article: The ship first looked like a small point on the sea. We had grown impatient at the delay and cheered when we saw it. For most of us this was an important _ , because the small object that had come into _ was a warship. Husbands, fathers, brothers and friends were coming home after a(n) _ of four years . We were _ that the ship would arrive in about 10 minutes. We cheered more _ than ever. The harbour had rarely _ such a colourful scene. It was decorated with flags and we were all wearing best summer clothes. The time we waited seemed _ ; but little by little the _ took the _ of a ship and, soon, it came so near that we could make out its name: Candia, on the ship. Now the crowd could hardly be stopped . People were jumping up and down, waving; and little boys _ onto still cars to get a better view. As the ship came into the harbour, everybody eagerly stared at the troops _ along the fences. Soldiers on board waved to us wildly, shouting out the names of people they _ or wanted to see. The two young men in the _ with a "Welcome Home!" banner almost fell over in their _ to lift it higher. Women were crying; others _ ; and some did not quite know whether to laugh or cry. Now the troops were directly above us. Our excitement had _ a peak, for soon they would come on shore.
